docs.snippet: Rodríguez, a young midfielder, scored both of Colombia’s goals, showing the talent that prompted A.S. Monaco to pay $61 million to acquire him.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rodríguez, a young midfielder, scored both of Colombia’s goals, showing the talent that prompted A.S. Monaco to pay $61 million to acquire him.
docs.abstract: Colombia beats Uruguay, 2-0, behind stellar play of midfielder James Rodriguez in World Cup Round of 16 action.

headline.main: World Cup 2014: James Rodríguez Leads Colombia Over Uruguay
headline.print_headline: Young Midfielder Leads Colombia Over a Fuming Uruguay

docs.snippet: Unlike the relatively restrained players in American sports leagues, goal scorers at the World Cup unleash celebrations ranging from joyous to defiant to bizarre.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unlike the relatively restrained players in American sports leagues, goal scorers at the World Cup unleash celebrations ranging from joyous to defiant to bizarre.
docs.abstract: World Cup in Brazil has produced dizzying number of goals, and wonderful variety of celebrations and outbursts from triumphant players; exuberance comes as refreshing change of pace from staid culture of sports in United States, where players are expected to remain stoic after scoring, and fines are issued for those who go too far.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Goal Celebrations in Soccer Are Always Colorful
headline.main: Cup Overflows: You Won’t See Joy Like This in the End Zone
headline.print_headline: Cup Overflows: You Won’t See Joy Like This in the End Zone

byline.contributor: Mary Pilon contributed reporting from New York, and Tim Rohan from St. Louis.

docs.snippet: Elimination matches pit the Netherlands vs. Mexico and Costa Rica vs. Greece.
docs.lead_paragraph: Elimination matches pit the Netherlands vs. Mexico and Costa Rica vs. Greece.

docs.snippet: Netherlands, who along with Colombia have lit up the World Cup in Brazil, face a tough test of their tournament credentials when they take on Mexico in the last 16 in Fortaleza on Sunday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Netherlands, who along with Colombia have lit up the World Cup in Brazil, face a tough test of their tournament credentials when they take on Mexico in the last 16 in Fortaleza on Sunday.

headline.main: Netherlands Aim to Maintain Surge Against Mexico
headline.print_headline: Netherlands Aim to Maintain Surge Against Mexico

docs.snippet: The Netherlands scored 10 goals in its first three games, and Robin van Persie and Arjen Robben have looked like world-beaters. Mexico, which barely scraped into the Cup, has restored some national pride with two good wins and a game draw against...
docs.abstract: The Netherlands scored 10 goals in its first three games, and Robin van Persie and Arjen Robben have looked like world-beaters. Mexico, which barely scraped into the Cup, has restored some national pride with two good wins and a game draw against Brazil.

headline.main: Mexico vs. Netherlands: World Cup 2014 Live Blog

docs.snippet: Police used pepper spray to break up fights between Brazilian and Uruguayan fans during a World Cup match at Rio de Janeiro's Maracana stadium on Saturday, a spokesman for the event's local organizing committee said on Sunday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Police used pepper spray to break up fights between Brazilian and Uruguayan fans during a World Cup match at Rio de Janeiro's Maracana stadium on Saturday, a spokesman for the event's local organizing committee said on Sunday.

headline.main: Police Use Pepper Spray to Break Up Fan Fight in Rio Stadium
headline.print_headline: Police Use Pepper Spray to Break Up Fan Fight in Rio Stadium

docs.snippet: Costa Rica is seen as a joyous, entertaining team that has enchanted crowds by winning the Group of Death over Uruguay, Italy and England. Greece is seen as a dour defensive team that scored just two goals in the group stage and spoiled the Ivory...
docs.abstract: Costa Rica is seen as a joyous, entertaining team that has enchanted crowds by winning the Group of Death over Uruguay, Italy and England. Greece is seen as a dour defensive team that scored just two goals in the group stage and spoiled the Ivory Coast’s dream with a marginal last-minute penalty.

headline.main: Costa Rica vs. Greece: World Cup 2014 Live Blog

docs.snippet: When Costa Rica sealed its first berth in the World Cup quarterfinals, the celebrating Ticos sprinted straight for Keylor Navas and mobbed him in celebration.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Costa Rica sealed its first berth in the World Cup quarterfinals, the celebrating Ticos sprinted straight for Keylor Navas and mobbed him in celebration.

headline.main: Navas Carries Costa Rica to World Cup Quarters
headline.print_headline: Navas Carries Costa Rica to World Cup Quarters

docs.snippet: From the beaches to the capital, Costa Ricans poured into the streets Sunday to celebrate the national team's historic World Cup victory over Greece that will put the team in the quarter finals for the first time.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the beaches to the capital, Costa Ricans poured into the streets Sunday to celebrate the national team's historic World Cup victory over Greece that will put the team in the quarter finals for the first time.

headline.main: Costa Rica Celebrates World Cup Win Over Greece
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Celebrates World Cup Win Over Greece

docs.snippet: Regulation time doesn't seem to mean much at this stage, judging by the way Netherlands, Costa Rica and Brazil have advanced through the first of the World Cup knockout rounds.
